content:
• Tuesday, February 26, 2019

  • Livent +6.7%, Bristow -10% on S&P SmallCap moves

    • Livent (NYSE:LTHM) finished after hours up 6.7% following word it's being added to the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • It will replace Bristow Group (NYSE:BRS), which slid 10.2% in the late session.
    • FMC (an S&P 500 constituent) is spinning out its holdings in Livent to shareholders, and S&P considers Livent more representative of the small-cap space than Bristow, which is ranked at the bottom.
    • The moves are effective prior to the open of trading on Tuesday, March 5.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 PM
  • MASI

    Masimo files for mixed shelf offering

    • Masimo (NASDAQ:MASI) has filed a prospectus for an unspecified mixed shelf offering.
    • Shares are up 4% after hours after its Q4 beat.
    • Previously: Masimo beats by $0.10, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 PM
  • RARE

    Ultragenyx prices stock offering at $60

    • Ultragenyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RARE) prices its public offering of ~5.1M shares of common stock at $60 per share. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional ~761K shares. Closing date is March 1.
    • Today's close was $61.51.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 PM
  • ADMP

    FDA rejects Adamis Pharma's application for sublingual tadalafil; shares down 13% after hours

    • The FDA has sent a Refusal to File letter to Adamis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADMP) in response to its marketing application seeking approval for a sublingual formulation of tadalafil for the treatment of erectile dysfunction.
    • A Refusal to File letter means that the application was not complete enough to allow for review. It cited the need for longer real-time stability data and additional data for both clinical and registration batches.
    • Tadalafil is the active ingredient in Eli Lilly's (NYSE:LLY) Cialis.
    • Shares are down 13% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 PM | 31 Comments
  • BHC

    Bausch Health to acquire Synergy assets for $195M

    • Bausch Health Companies (NYSE:BHC) has agreed to acquire certain assets of bankrupt Synergy Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGYP) for ~$195M in cash plus the assumption of certain liabilities.
    • The assets include GI disorder med Trulance (plecanatide).
    • The hearing to approve the sale is scheduled for March 1.
    • BHC is up 1% after hours.
    • Update: SGYP is down 65% on Wednesday, February 27.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 PM | 138 Comments
  • MYL

    Mylan Q4 EPS miss pressures shares, down 10% after hours

    • Mylan N.V. (NASDAQ:MYL) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 3,078.7 (-4.9%).
    • Net income: 51.2 (-79.0%); non-GAAP net income: 669.7 (-12.5%); EPS: 0.10 (-78.3%); non-GAAP EPS: 1.30 (-9.1%).
    • Cash flow ops (full year): $2.34B (+13.6%).
    • 2019 guidance:  Revenues: $11,500M - 12,500M; non-GAAP net income: $2,000M - 2,500M; non-GAAP EPS: $3.80 - 4.80.
    • Shares are down 10% after hours.
    • Previously: Mylan misses by $0.05, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 PM | 8 Comments
  • LPSN

    LivePerson -3.4% on $150M convertible debt offering

    • LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is 3.4% lower after proposing a private offering of $150M in convertible senior debt.
    • The offering is to come in notes due 2024, to qualified institutional buyers. Initial purchasers are expected to get a 13-day option to buy up to an additional $22.5M worth of the notes.
    • Interest, conversion rate, offering price and other terms will come at pricing.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • SE

    Sea Limited +4% after revenues more than double in Q4

    • Sea Limited (NYSE:SE) is up 4% postmarket after it topped expectations with its Q4 loss and revenues that more than doubled and beat consensus, along with healthy 2019 guidance.
    • The company saw a sixfold increase in e-commerce as Shopee saw GMV, orders and adjusted revenue all rising sharply. Three years after launch, the platform has exceeded $10B in gross merchandise value.
    • Adjusted EBITDA overall was -$203.6M, down from -$140.2M due to e-commerce. Digital entertainment EBITDA doubled to $105.2M.
    • Revenue breakout: Digital Entertainment, $131.3M (up 23.5%); E-commerce and other services, $112.4M (up 532.8%); Sales of goods, $39.6M (up 7,416% from year-ago $0.5M).
    • For 2019, it's expecting adjusted revenue for digital entertainment of $1.2B-$1.3B (81.5%-96.7% growth Y/Y) and e-commerce revenue of $630M-$660M (up 116.7%-127% Y/Y). Consensus for total revenues in 2019 is $1.37B, or 43.9% Y/Y growth.
    • Conference call to come at 7 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: Sea beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Feb. 26 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital -1.3% after announcing $150M notes offering

    • Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) slips 1.3% in after-hours trading after the company announces a public offering of $150M of convertible notes due 2025.
    • Intends to grant underwriters an overallotment option for up to $22.5M more notes.
    • Sees using a part of the proceeds to repurchase from time to time a portion of its 4.75% senior convertible notes due 2020.
    • As of February 25, 2019, the estimated asset coverage of the 2020 notes was 1556.5%, accounting for Prospect’s recent issuances of debt in the amount of $38.5M.
    • Previously: Prospect Capital fiscal Q2 NII in line, NAV falls (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 38 Comments
  • GNW

    Genworth +4.2% after GLIC cash flow testing shows positive margin

    • Genworth Financial (NYSE:GNW) gains 4.2% in after-hours trading after reporting aggregated cash flow testing for Genworth Life Insurance Company resulted in a positive margin of about $1.5B after including about $2.1B of provision for adverse deviation.
    • The 2018 margin results improved by about $0.9B.
    • Aggregated CFT result for Genworth Life Insurance Company of New York indicate no incremental CFT reserves beyond those held at Dec. 31, 2017. Results include about $1.2B of New York Department of Financial Services required PADs.
    • Previously: Genworth -5.4% after posting Q4 adjusted operating loss (Feb. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 88 Comments

  • Windstream wins 'first day' approvals, access to $400M; shares +2.5%

    • Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) won approvals for the "first day" motions tied to its day one in bankruptcy court.
    • That includes getting interim approval to access up to $400M of the $1B in debtor-in-possession financing provided by Citi.
    • Shares are up 2.5% after hours; they closed the regular day up 5.5%. Linked company Uniti Group (NASDAQ:UNIT) closed the day down 3.2% and is off 0.6% after hours.
    • And Windstream is approved to operate in normal course of business, and to pay vendors in full for all goods and services received after yesterday's filing date.
    • Previously: Windstream firming up DIP financing; shares +6% (Feb. 26 2019)
    • Previously: Aurelius on Windstream Chapter 11: Manipulation charges are 'nonsense' (Feb. 25 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 86 Comments

  • FTR, PANW, WLL and WTW among notable after hour movers

    • Gainers: TNDM +14.6%. JAZZ +9.1%. FTR +11.3%. DF +9.0%. PANW +8.0%.
    • Losers: WTW -23.6%. ELF -18.9%. EVH -16.5%. VICR -13.4%. WLL -11.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • VNOM

    Viper Energy Partners launches 8M-unit public offering

    • Viper Energy Partners (NASDAQ:VNOM) -3.8% after-hours on news of a planned public offering of 8M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.2M common units.
    • VNOM says it plans to use the proceeds to purchase units of Viper Energy Partners LLC, which will repay part of the outstanding borrowings under Viper’s revolving credit facility.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 11 Comments
  • VICR

    Vicor -11% on Q4 weighed by "sudden tailwinds"

    • Vicor (NASDAQ:VICR) plunges 10.8% on Q4 results the company says  reflects "sudden headwinds including temporary softness in data center spending and the impact of tariffs on imports by China."
    • Fourth quarter bookings dropped 15% Y/Y to $60.5M. The total backlog grew 41% to $103M.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Vicor reports Q4 results (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 9 Comments
  • OPRX

    OptimizeRx +20% amid record revenues, guidance for more growth

    • Healthcare communications specialist OptimizeRx (NASDAQ:OPRX) is up 19.8% after hours following a solid beat on revenues in Q4 along with guidance for healthy growth in 2019.
    • Revenues grew 64% to a record level, thanks to more pharmaceutical engagements along with more distribution points and growth with new messaging solutions.
    • GAAP net loss narrowed, to $110,000 from $237,000, and non-GAAP net income jumped to $842,000 from $280,000.
    • It now says it expects to be GAAP profitable on a quarterly basis.
    • Cash and equivalents were $8.9M at Dec. 31, up from a prior-year $5.1M. Cash flow from operations was $696,000 for the year.
    • "As we continue to demonstrate high ROI from pharma marketing spend and deploy new solutions, we expect increasing adoption of our digital health platform by EHRs, hospital systems, and ultimately new and existing pharma clients," says CEO William Febbo. "As a result, we anticipate healthy revenue growth to continue in 2019, driving greater profitability.”
    • Previously: OptimizeRx EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Feb. 26 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • IMMR

    Immersion -3.7% despite beats, haptic deal

    • Immersion (NASDAQ:IMMR) drops 3.7% after Q4 results that beat estimates and reported 58% Y/Y revenue growth. FY19 guidance has revenue from $24M to $30M, which might not be comparable to the $74.3M consensus.
    • Haptic deal: Immersion also announces signing a license agreement with Dongwoon Anatech to make Immersion haptic patent licenses available to mobile phone and wearables OEMs through Dongwoon.
    • Previously: Immersion beats by $0.14, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • WHLR

    Wheeler REIT +2.6% as Q4 rental revenue rises

    • Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust (NASDAQ:WHLR) jumps 2.6% in after-hours trading after Q4 rental revenue rose to $12.6M from $10.9M in the year-ago quarter.
    • Q4 operating loss narrowed to $3.69M from $4.95M.
    • Q4 adjusted FFO per share of 15 cents fell from 18 cents a year ago.
    • Conference call on Feb. 27 at 10:00 AM ET.
    • Previously: Wheeler REIT reports Q4 results (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 13 Comments
  • KPTI

    FDA advisory committee delays vote on Karyopharm's selinexor

    • The FDA's Oncologic Drugs Advisory Committee voted 8 - 5 to delay its verdict on Karyopharm Therapeutics' (NASDAQ:KPTI) selinexor until topline data from the Phase 3 BOSTON study are available.
    • Shares are currently halted. No resumption time has been provided by Nasdaq.
    • Update: The company says the data from BOSTON should be available in late Q4 or Q1 2020. Shares are down 20% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy -2.8% on mixed Q4

    • Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) falls 2.8% on mixed Q4 results that beat revenue estimates with 16% Y/Y growth but missed on EPS. Upside Q1 guidance puts revenue from $90M to $95M compared to the $80.94M consensus.
    • ENPH shipped 257 megawatts DC, or approximately 820,000 microinverters, in the quarter.
    • Non-GAAP gross margin fell 210 bps Q/Q to 30.7% partly due to fees related to component shortages.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Enphase Energy misses by $0.02, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 15 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers plunges nearly 25% on soft numbers

    • Alongside Q4 earnings, Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) guides to 2019 EPS of $1.25-$1.50, well shy of current analyst estimates of $2.50-$3.85. The big miss suggests the numbers may not be comparable. Revenues are seen at $1.4B vs. estimates of about $1.66B.
    • Management: "Due to the soft start to the key Winter Season, we expect member recruitment for 2019 to be below 2018 levels, resulting in lower revenue and earnings for the year."
    • Conference call starts at 5 ET.
    • Shares are down 23.6% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 51 Comments
  • TNDM

    New chief at Tandem Diabetes Care

    • Tandem Diabetes Care (NASDAQ:TNDM) EVP and COO John Sheridan will assume the CEO role March 1 succeeding Kim Blickenstaff who will transition to Executive Chairman.
    • Chairman Dick Allen will transition to Lead Independent Director.
    • Board member Fred Cohen, M.D., D.Phil. will not stand for re-election.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • TOL

    Toll Brothers +4.5% after fiscal Q1 blows away consensus

    • Toll Brothers (NYSE:TOL) gains 4.5% in after-hours trading after Q1 EPS of 76 cents beats the average analyst estimate of 61 cents and revenue of $1.36B, which beat the consensus estimate by $100M.
    • Total home sale for the quarter ended Jan. 31, 2019 fell to 1,530 units from 1,423 a year ago; average price per unit increased to $862,300 from $826,00 a year ago.
    • Q1 cancellation rate of 9.6% vs. 5.3% a year earlier.
    • Sees Q2 deliveries of 1,650-1,850 units with an average price of $860,000-$890,000.
    • Sees Q2 adjusted home sales gross margin of about 23.1%
    • “Given that we are in the early stages of the spring selling season and in light of current market conditions, there continues to be a wide range of possible results for our full fiscal year," says Toll CFO Martin P. Connor.
    • Previously: Toll Brothers beats by $0.15, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • DF

    Strategic alternatives for Dean Foods; shares zoom 10%

    • The company announces the start of a review to explore and evaluate potential strategic alternatives, with Evercore hired to assist.
    • Source: Press Release
    • DF +9.7% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 13 Comments
  • TNDM

    Tandem Diabetes Care Q4 beat propels shares, up 16% after hours

    • Tandem Diabetes Care (NASDAQ:TNDM) Q4 results ($M): Sales: 76.2 (+89.1%).
    • Net income: 3.7 (+132.3%); EPS: 0.02 (+101.6%).
    • 2019 guidance: Sales: $255M - 270M; non-GAAP EBITDA: break even.
    • Shares are up 16% after hours.
    • Previously: Tandem Diabetes Care beats by $0.22, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • BNFT

    Benefitfocus -8.8% on downside guide, secondary offering

    • Benefitfocus (NASDAQ:BNFT) drops 8.8% with its Q4 beats offset by downside Q1 guidance and a secondary offering.
    • Q1 guidance has revenue of $66.5M to $68.5M (consensus: $71.52M). Upside FY19 outlook has revenue from $301M to $309M compared to the $297.55M estimate.
    • Secondary offering: Certain funds managed by Goldman Sachs and Mercer will offer about 5.7M shares of common stock. The sellers have granted the underwriters the option to purchase up to 855,714 in additional shares.
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Benefitfocus beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharma Q4 Xyrem sales up 20%; shares up 10% after hours

    • Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 476.5 (+9.2%).
    • Key product sales: Xyrem: 374.8 (+19.9%); Erwinaze: 24.3 (-49.2%); Vyxeos: 25.6 (+6.2%); Defitelio: 37.7 (+3.9%).
    • Net income: 159.5 (-31.3%); non-GAAP net income: 220.0(+21.9%); EPS: 2.64 (-30.3%); non-GAAP EPS: 3.64 (+23.4%).
    • 2019 guidance: Revenues: $2,050M - 2,130M; product sales: $2,05M - 2,110M; Xyrem: $1,530M - 1,570M; EPS: $6.80 - 8.50; non-GAAP EPS: $14.30 - 15.00.
    • Shares are up 10% after hours.
    • Previously: Jazz Pharmaceuticals beats by $0.62, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • ELF

    e.l.f. Beauty -12% after store closings, light sales tally

    • Shares of e.l.f. Beauty (NYSE:ELF) are down 12.2% AH after the company announces that it will close 22 retail stores to refocus on the e-commerce business. A one-time accounting charge related to the closings of $23M to $25M will be incurred.
    • The company also says CFO John Bailey will step down from his position at the end of March.
    • On the earnings front, Q3 sales from e.l.f. Beauty arrived in at $79M vs. $85M consensus.
    • SEC Form 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 3 Comments
  • PLNT

    Planet Fitness beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Planet Fitness (NYSE:PLNT): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.02; GAAP EPS of $0.29 in-line.
    • Revenue of $174.36M (+30.1% Y/Y) beats by $0.6M.
    • Shares +4.59%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • PZZA

    Papa John's misses by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • Papa John's (NASDAQ:PZZA): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.02; GAAP EPS of -$0.44.
    • Revenue of $373.98M (-20.0% Y/Y) misses by $18.19M.
    • Shares +2.37%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 6 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto +3.8% on Q2 beats, $1B buyback

    • Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) gains 3.8% on Q2 results that beat estimates with 30% Y/Y revenue growth and featured in-line Q3 guidance plus a $1B buyback.
    • The Q3 outlook sees revenue from $697M to $707M, which matches consensus on the low end, and EPS from $1.23 to $1.25 (consensus: $1.25).
    • Q2 billings grew 27% Y/Y to $852.5M. Both sides of the business beat revenue estimates with Product totaling $271.6M and Services coming out at  $439.6M.
    • Non-GAAP operating margin was 24.6% compared to the 21.4% estimate.
    • Buyback: The board authorizes a $1B share repurchase program that will expire on December 31, 2020.
    • Earnings call starts at 4:30 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Palo Alto Networks beats by $0.29, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 11 Comments
  • OPGN

    OpGen misses by $0.09, beats on revenue

    • OpGen (NASDAQ:OPGN): Q4 GAAP EPS of -$0.47 misses by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $0.76M (-23.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.05M.
    • Shares +6.94%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo -5.7% amid revenue drop-off for Q4

    • TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) is 5.7% lower postmarket after revenues fell 21% and the company swung to a loss amid a $269M goodwill impairment.
    • The company's still in ongoing discussions over outcomes for its Product and IP Licensing businesses: "Due to the unique nature of our Product and IP Licensing businesses, this process is taking longer than we hoped." But the company's working internally to prepare for the separation of the businesses.
    • Product revenues fell 4%, and while overall revenues dropped 21%, backing out Legacy TiVo Solutions IP Licenses, Hardware and Other products, shows core revenue dropped just 11%, to $160.98M.
    • IP Licensing revenue fell 37%.
    • Product revenue breakout: Platform Solutions, $74.5M (down 8%); Software and Services, $18.3M (down 5%).
    • TiVo's still declining to provide guidance due to the "broad range of potential outcomes" in its in-depth review of businesses, cost structure and strategic options.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: TiVo misses by $2.21, misses on revenue (Feb. 26 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • PLNT

    Planet Fitness +3% after strong sales guidance

    • Planet Fitness (NYSE:PLNT) jumps 3.30% in AH trading after setting a strong outlook for the full year.
    • During Q4, Planet Fitness saw system-wide same store sales increase 10.1% and sold equipment into 104 new stores. That momentum is expected to continue in 2019.
    • The company sees FY19 revenue of $657M vs. $638M consensus on same-store sales growth in the high single digits.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 5 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers misses by $0.14, misses on revenue

    • Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.46 misses by $0.14; GAAP EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $330.39M (+5.7% Y/Y) misses by $16.58M.
    • Shares +1.12%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 11 Comments
  • BGS

    B&G Foods -10% after earnings dud, soft guidance

    • B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS) slumps after Q4 results fall well short of the consensus estimates.
    • Adjusted EBITDA fell 15.2% Y/Y to $58.5M during the quarter. Gross profit was 19.0% of sales vs. 20.1% a year ago.
    • Looking ahead, B&G expects full-year sales range to fall in a range of $1.635B to $1.665B vs. $1.65B consensus and adjusted EBITDA of $305M to $320M vs. $324M consensus. EPS of $1.85 to $2.00 is anticipated for the full year vs. $2.03 consensus.
    • BGS -9.95% AH to $22.21.
    • Previously: B&G Foods misses by $0.16, misses on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 27 Comments
  • ALDR

    Alder Bio readies equity offering; shares down 2% after hours

    • Alder BioPharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALDR) is down 2% after hours in response to its planned $105M public offering of common stock concurrently with a $20M private placement of shares to affiliates of Redmile Group, LLC.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • FTR

    Frontier Communications +6.8% as Q4 loss tops expectations

    • Frontier Communications (NYSE:FTR) is up 6.8% in early after-hours moves following a better-than-expected loss in its adjusted earnings.
    • Customer revenues were flat year-over-year, meaning that a 4.1% revenue drop came from subsidy declines. Revenue was also stable sequentially.
    • A net loss of $219M was driven by goodwill impairment; EBITDA rose Q/Q to $895M.
    • Revenue breakout: Consumer, $1.09B (up 0.2%); Commercial, $942M (up 0.1%); Subsidy/regulatory, $94M (down 50.5%).
    • Revenue by segment: Data and Internet services, $959M (up 2.1%); Voice Services, $668M (down 2.8%); Video Services, $275M (down 11.3%);
    • The leverage ratio as of Dec. 31 was 4.72 to 1.
    • For 2019, it's guiding to EBITDA of $3.45B-$3.55B, capex of about $1.15B, and operating free cash flow of $575M-$675M.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: Frontier Communications beats by $0.09, beats on revenue (Feb. 26 2019)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 44 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks beats by $0.29, beats on revenue

    • Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.51 beats by $0.29; GAAP EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $711.2M (+30.4% Y/Y) beats by $29.05M.
    • Shares +2.39%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • VEEV

    Veeva +2.4% on Q4 beats, upside outlook

    • Veeva Systems (NYSE:VEEV) gains 2.4% after Q4 beats with 25% Y/Y revenue growth and upside Q1 outlook that has revenue from $238M to $239M (consensus: $233M) and EPS from $0.44 to $0.45 (consensus: $0.40).
    • FY20 forecast has revenue at $1.03B compared to the $1.02B consensus.
    • Earnings call starts at 4:30 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Veeva Systems beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 19 Comments
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals beats by $0.62, beats on revenue

    • Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $3.64 beats by $0.62; GAAP EPS of $2.64 beats by $0.65.
    • Revenue of $476.5M (+9.2% Y/Y) beats by $16.83M.
    • Shares +9.8%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • GWPH

    GW Pharma Q4 top line up 67%; shares ahead 2% after hours

    • GW Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:GWPH) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 6.7 (+66.7%); product sales: 6.6 (+198.1%).
    • Net loss: (71.9) (-16.3%); loss/share: (0.20) (flat); cash flow ops: (74.5) (-44.4%).
    • Shares are up 2% after hours.
    • Previously: GW Pharmaceuticals beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • NYMT

    New York Mortgage Trust plans 15M-share offering; shares -2.5%

    • New York Mortgage Trust (NASDAQ:NYMT) slides 2.5% in after-hours trading after announcing plans to sell 15M shares of common stock in a public offering.
    • Expects greenshoe option for an additional 2.25M shares.
    • Previously: New York Mortgage Trust announces pricing of upsized public offering of common stock (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 26 Comments
  • MELI

    MercadoLibre +7% after posting sizzling growth

    • MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI) reports revenue soared 63% in Q4 on a constant currency basis.
    • Gross merchandise volume was up 18% during the quarter.
    • Total payments transactions increased 72% to 126M.
    • Unique buyers were up 8%.

  • Spotify CFO: China 'bet' comes via Tencent Music; emphasis on podcasts

    • Alongside imminent plans to launch as soon as today in the key market of India, Spotify (SPOT -2.4%) clarifies its "China bet" comes via Tencent Music Entertainment (TME -4%).
    • Speaking at a Morgan Stanley Conference, CFO Barry McCarthy says the company loses money for years in new markets, but its investment in TME is worth about $2.6B now.
    • McCarthy (the former CFO at Netflix) says Spotify isn't trying to take on Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) in video, but Netflix provides a model for Spotify potential: At the video streamer, they had 100,000 things to choose from, Netflix was good at helping people discover what they like, and so 70% of rental mix was catalog.
    • "What's music have in comparison?" he asks. "Forty million things. The potential to add value (via discovery) is infinitely greater" than in video.
    • The company plans to double down on exclusive, original podcasts, he says.
    • As for the dispute with Warner Music, "lots of drama" but it's not really about India, it's about leverage, he says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 7 Comments

  • Windstream firming up DIP financing; shares +6%

    • Windstream (NASDAQ:WIN) is back in court today, looking for approval of specifics to its debtor-in-possession financing, Bloomberg reports.
    • Shares are up 6% today, looking to break a streak after five straight down days following its trial loss to Aurelius.
    • Of $1B arranged by Citigroup, the company's filing for $500M in a revolving credit facility and $500M in a term loan.
    • Once the interim DIP order is approved, the company would initially have access to $100M from the revolver and $300M from the term loan, and: “Absent access to the DIP facilities, the debtors would likely need to liquidate immediately, to the detriment of their stakeholders."
    • Windstream says it received "multiple proposals from lenders within and outside the capital structure for both out- of-court and in-court financing."
    • And after Uniti Group (NASDAQ:UNIT) broke a four-day losing streak yesterday, its shares are back down 7.8% today. Windstream is Uniti Group's biggest customer via a master lease.
    • Windstream filed for bankruptcy yesterday as it sorted out how to make an accelerated payment on bonds on which it was ruled to have defaulted.

  • SPOT

    Variety: With pricing set, Spotify India launch could come today

    • After a few delays (and some litigation), Spotify (SPOT -2%) looks set to launch its service as soon as today in the key market of India, after the company unveiled its regional pricing plan, Variety reports.
    • Some tension with the big three record labels came around details of the promotional free period timing among other pricing factors.
    • Now Spotify will offer its premium service in India free for 30 days, and then for 119 rupees (about $1.67) per month -- one rupee cheaper than Apple Music in India. It also has plans timed to single days, weeks, and months along with 3-month, 6-month and annual deals (for 1,189 rupees/year) along with student discounts.
    • Meanwhile, like rival services it will offer a free ad-supported tier.
    • And while it has deals with Sony Music and Universal Music Group, it currently plans to use a TV/radio broadcast workaround on Warner Music that the latter is challenging with an injunction.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 2 Comments
